cause.description:
Partners In Health was started in 1987 by Paul Farmer, Thomas J. White, Todd McCormack, Ophelia Dahl, and Jim Yong Kim.
The PIH Vision: Whatever it takes At its root, our mission is both medical and moral. It is based on solidarity, rather than charity alone. When a person in Peru, or Siberia, or rural Haiti falls ill, PIH uses all of the means at our disposal to make them well—from pressuring drug manufacturers, to lobbying policy makers, to providing medical care and social services. Whatever it takes. Just as we would do if a member of our own family—or we ourselves—were ill. (source http://www.pih.org/who/vision.html)
1. Preferential option for the poor in health care!
2. The health care system must be changed to provide universal health care.
3. Health care and social services go hand in hand.
4. Access to primary health care
5. Free health care and education for the poor
6. Community partnerships
7. Addressing basic social and economic needs
8. Serving the poor through the public sector
